result.execSummary:
All charges against Todd C Coleman in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Todd C Coleman is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd C Coleman

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($750 sig bond) gj

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Louis E Epps in court earlier, appears by phone.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
Defendant is deceased.  At the request of the state, Court orders case closed.  Warrant canceled.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report received and filed.  aw
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Todd C Coleman not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO FILE IN COURT.
Defendant missed an office contact on 4/29/2014.  Court contacted Justice Point case worker, Joycelyn, who has had no contact with the defendant.  Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court will inform attorney Epps of today's proceedings.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Todd C Coleman in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  

AS TO THE AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court adjourns sentencing for defendant to bring in verification of employment.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 6/30/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed.

Count 1:  Possession of narcotic drugs, contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(3g)(am), 939.50(3)(i).  A class I felony.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Todd C Coleman in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel is in trial before Judge Watts.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 4/29/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Todd C Coleman in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 4/24/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription, and to make sure all drug tests are negative.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Todd C Coleman in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Paul Hauer for Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Todd C Coleman in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Todd C Coleman in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
